tips.text: Own your hinge. Keep the bell close and your lats on.
Breathe behind the shield: brace, then move.
Start small: consistency beats intensity.
If your grip is failing early, drop the weight and earn cleaner reps.
Finish tall: glutes on, ribs down, eyes forward.
Two great reps beat ten sloppy reps.
If your shoulders shrug in the swing, pack the lats and keep the bell close.
Warm-up should raise readiness, not fatigue.
Nasal breathing in warm-ups can help you stay relaxed and organized.
For presses: squeeze the handle and keep your wrist stacked.
Treat rest like training: shake it out, breathe, and reset your setup.
If your low back feels the swing, make the hinge smaller and snap harder.
Don’t chase soreness. Chase repeatable training.
Protein is a lever: hit a consistent target first, then adjust carbs/fats.
Hydration check: pale yellow is a simple daily anchor.
If you’re tight in the hinge, try a slow exhale and reach your hips back.
For cleans: keep the bell close and let it roll around the hand, not slam.
Consistency beats novelty. Repeat the basics until they look effortless.
If you miss sessions, shrink the plan — never abandon the plan.
Walk 10 minutes after meals if you want an easy recovery and digestion win.

clinics.title: Clean Clinic
clinics.description: A smoother rack and cleaner turnover without forearm bruises.

clinics.title: Press Clinic
clinics.description: Build a strong overhead press with stacked joints and a stable torso.

clinics.title: Get-Up Clinic
clinics.description: Own each position in the Turkish get-up with clean transitions.

programs.title: Beginner Program
programs.description: Start here after the Swing Clinic.

steps.title: Goal
steps.text: Build a crisp hinge and a consistent swing arc. Quality > volume.

steps.title: Setup
steps.text: Feet about shoulder width, ribs down, lats on. Hike like a football snap.

steps.title: Key cues
steps.text: Hinge (don’t squat). Snap the hips. Arms are hooks. Bell stays close.

steps.title: Common fixes
steps.text: If the bell is pulling you forward: hike harder and pack the lats. If you’re squatting: push hips back and keep shins more vertical.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: What cue helped most? What will you focus on next time?

workouts.title: Clean Clinic
workouts.description: A smooth clean that lands quietly in the rack.

steps.title: Goal
steps.text: Reduce impact on the forearm by keeping the bell close and guiding the handle.

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 2 minutes: arm swings, wrist circles, halos (light).

steps.title: Drill
steps.text: 5 minutes: dead clean to rack (slow), focus on the hand insertion.

steps.title: Practice
steps.text: 6 sets of 5 cleans per side. Stop if the bell is slapping.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: What fixed the clean today? (handle angle, elbow path, or timing)

workouts.title: Press Clinic
workouts.description: Stacked wrist/elbow/shoulder with a stable ribcage.

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 2 minutes: shoulder circles, scap push-ups, light rack holds.

steps.title: Setup
steps.text: Rack position: forearm vertical, wrist stacked, elbow slightly in front of ribs.

steps.title: Press practice
steps.text: 5 sets of 5 presses per side. Exhale through the sticking point.

steps.title: Optional
steps.text: If it feels good: 2 sets of 8 slow negatives per side.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: Log weight and the hardest rep. What did you do to stay stacked?

workouts.title: Get-Up Clinic
workouts.description: Own each position in the Turkish get-up with clean transitions.

steps.title: Goal
steps.text: Treat the get-up as a sequence of strong positions. Move slow enough to stay in control.

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 2 minutes: shoulder circles, hip openers, and a few unloaded get-up reps.

steps.title: Positions
steps.text: Fetal → Tall sit → High bridge → Sweep to lunge → Stand. Pause 2 breaths at each stop.

steps.title: Practice
steps.text: 3 rounds: 1 get-up per side. Rest and reset between sides.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: Which position felt weakest today? (tall sit / bridge / sweep / lunge / stand)

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 3 minutes: hip hinge drill + glute bridge + 5 slow deadlifts with the bell.

steps.title: Main
steps.text: 10 sets of 10 two-hand swings. Rest 45–75s. Stop 1–2 reps before form breaks.

steps.title: Optional
steps.text: If you feel fresh: suitcase carry 3 x 30–45s per side.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: Bell weight, total sets completed, and a 1–10 effort rating.

workouts.title: Week 1 • Day 2
workouts.description: Technique review + bracing + light rack work.

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 2 minutes: 4-count inhale / 6-count exhale, then 5 braced hinges.

steps.title: Main
steps.text: 8 sets of 10 swings. Between sets: 1 slow exhale + reset the stance.

steps.title: Accessory
steps.text: Rack hold 4 x 20–30s per side (light). Keep ribs down.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: What cue did you use most today? Any form breakdown?

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 3 minutes: mobility + 2 x 10 dead-stop swings (light).

steps.title: Main
steps.text: 12 sets of 8 swings. Rest 45–75s. Focus on a quiet hike + tall finish.

steps.title: Cooldown
steps.text: 2 minutes: easy hamstring stretch + slow breathing.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: What improved since Day 1? What still feels awkward?

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 2 minutes: halos (light), rack holds, and wrist circles.

steps.title: Main
steps.text: 6 sets of 5 cleans per side. Smooth turnover—no forearm slap.

steps.title: Accessory
steps.text: 3 sets of 5 presses per side (light). Stay stacked.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: Log weights used and a note on clean quality (quiet/rough).

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 3 minutes: hinge drill + 5 slow goblet squats (light).

steps.title: Main
steps.text: 10-minute density: 10 swings every minute (EMOM). Keep it crisp and easy.

steps.title: Carry
steps.text: Suitcase carry 4 x 30–45s per side. Tall posture, slow steps.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: How did the EMOM feel? (easy/moderate/hard). Any grip notes?

workouts.title: Week 2 • Day 1
workouts.description: Build swing volume + add light clean practice.

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 3 minutes: hip hinge drill, glute bridges, and 2 x 10 dead-stop swings (light).

steps.title: Main
steps.text: 12 sets of 10 swings. Rest 45–75s. Every rep should look the same.

steps.title: Skill
steps.text: 5 sets of 3 cleans per side (light). Quiet rack.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: Swing sets completed + one clean cue that worked.

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 2 minutes: halos (light), rack holds, and 5 slow presses (very light).

steps.title: Main
steps.text: 5 sets of 5 presses per side (moderate). Rest as needed. Stay stacked.

steps.title: Finisher
steps.text: 6 sets of 10 swings (easy). Crisp reps, no grind.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: Press weight + hardest rep + shoulder feel (good/iffy).

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 3 minutes: hinge drill + short walk + 10 easy swings.

steps.title: Main
steps.text: 12-minute density: 8 swings every minute (EMOM). Keep it easy and sharp.

steps.title: Carry
steps.text: Farmer carry (two bells if available) 6 x 30–45s with full recovery.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: How steady was pace? Any grip/low back notes?

workouts.title: Week 3 • Day 1
workouts.description: Progress swing volume + maintain clean technique.

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 3 minutes: hinge drill + 2 x 10 dead-stop swings (light).

steps.title: Main
steps.text: 14 sets of 10 swings. Rest 45–75s. Keep it crisp — no grind reps.

steps.title: Skill
steps.text: 6 sets of 3 cleans per side (light/moderate). Quiet rack.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: Swing quality (1–10) + what you did to keep reps identical.

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 2 minutes: halos (light), rack holds, and 5 very light presses.

steps.title: Main
steps.text: Press ladder x 3 rounds: 1-2-3 per side. Rest 60–90s between rungs.

steps.title: Swings
steps.text: 6 sets of 10 swings (easy). Focus on hinge and float.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: Press weight + which rung got shaky + shoulder notes.

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 3 minutes: shoulder prep + hip openers + 1 unloaded get-up per side.

steps.title: Main
steps.text: 4 rounds: 1 get-up per side. Pause at each position. Move slow.

steps.title: Carry
steps.text: Suitcase carry 4 x 30–45s per side. Tall posture.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: Which get-up position was hardest today? Any wrist/shoulder notes?

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 3 minutes: hinge drill + 10 easy swings + 5 light cleans per side.

steps.title: Main
steps.text: 14-minute density: 8 swings every minute (EMOM). Easy pace.

steps.title: Skill
steps.text: 5 sets of 4 cleans per side (light). Quiet turnover.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: How consistent was the EMOM? Any clean slap today?

steps.title: Warm-up
steps.text: 5 minutes easy walk or bike. Then 5 slow hinges.

steps.title: Technique
steps.text: 6 sets of 8 swings (very easy). Stop before any fatigue shows.

steps.title: Mobility
steps.text: 5 minutes: hips + hamstrings + t-spine. Slow breathing.

steps.title: Log
steps.text: How do you feel right now vs when you started? (better/same/worse)
